question.text: "Sequence annotation" in human genome project refers to

options.text: identification of only those genes that are expressed as RNA
correlating, sequence of nucleotides already known for an organism, to their functions
selection of base sequences not involved in protein synthesis

solution.text:
Human Genome Project (HGP) was a mega project started in 1990 to identify approximately 20000-25000 genes present in around 3×109 base pairs that make up human DNA. Two methodologies were used in HGP namely

i) EST -Expressed sequence tags - which focused on identifying all the genes that are expressed as RNA

ii) Whole genome sequencing - sequence all the coding and non-coding regions and later assigning different regions in a sequence to its function (Sequence annotation)

This has helped us in understanding various molecular mechanism and treatment of various diseases.
